body:
@alalazo @tgamblin @adamjstewart @mathstuf`

I'm running on an old SuSE system with obviously out-of-date software (eg: Python 2.6):

```
$ uname -a
Linux discover16 3.0.101-0.47.79-default #1 SMP Fri Apr 22 06:30:00 UTC 2016 (9d3a4e8) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ cat /etc/SuSE-release
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 (x86_64)
VERSION = 11
PATCHLEVEL = 3
```

A `module load` command of Spack-generate modules produces the following error:

```
$ module load linux-SuSE11-x86_64/m4-1.4.17-gcc-5.3.0-lheed2t
cmdPath.c(156):ERROR:11: Usage is 'prepend-pathpath-variable directory'
linux-SuSE11-x86_64/m4-1.4.17-gcc-5.3.0-lheed2t(12):ERROR:102: Tcl command execution failed: prepend-path --delim ":" PATH "/gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack2/opt/spack/linux-SuSE11-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/m4-1.4.17-lheed2tiee3dqj2e73xfqr46jgzhefys/bin"
```

This didn't used to happen.  What version of `module` and `tcl` am I running?

```
$ module --version
3.1.6
$ echo 'puts $tcversion;exit 0' | tclsh
8.5
```

I noticed that there has been a change in the format of the module files that is causing this problem.  For example, in the `binutils` module file generated by the old Spack (it loaded just fine), I have:

```
prepend-path PATH "/gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/binutils-2.26-jt3fjwoi4s5yvt7kf5jw3jzozqzcd4yn/bin"
```

The module file generated by the new Spack (which doesn't work) looks like:

```
prepend-path --delim ":" PATH "/gpfsm/dnb53/rpfische/spack2/opt/spack/linux-SuSE11-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/binutils-2.25-6w5d2t454o53bxixyhx2ajm4wsjgb4xv/bin"
```

Any ideas?
title: [BUG] Modules fail on old Linux (SLES 11)
